verses.kjv: And I, brethren, could not speak unto you as unto spiritual, but as unto carnal, even as unto babes in Christ.
verses.web: Brothers, I couldn’t speak to you as to spiritual, but as to fleshly, as to babies in Christ.
verses.ct: Brothers, I couldn't talk to you the way I'd talk to people who are spiritually mature. I had to speak to you as people still controlled by your human nature — like infants in Christ.

verses.kjv: I have fed you with milk, and not with meat: for hitherto ye were not able to bear it, neither yet now are ye able.
verses.web: I fed you with milk, not with meat; for you weren’t yet ready. Indeed, you aren’t ready even now,
verses.ct: I gave you milk, not solid food, because you weren't ready for it. And honestly, you're still not ready.

verses.kjv: For ye are yet carnal: for whereas there is among you envying, and strife, and divisions, are ye not carnal, and walk as men?
verses.web: for you are still fleshly. For insofar as there is jealousy, strife, and factions among you, aren’t you fleshly, and don’t you walk in the ways of men?
verses.ct: You're still living by your human nature. As long as there's jealousy, fighting, and division among you, aren't you proving that you're no different from everyone else?

verses.kjv: For while one saith, I am of Paul; and another, I am of Apollos; are ye not carnal?
verses.web: For when one says, “I follow Paul,” and another, “I follow Apollos,” aren’t you fleshly?
verses.ct: When one of you says, "I follow Paul," and another says, "I follow Apollos," aren't you acting like people who don't know God at all?

verses.kjv: Who then is Paul, and who is Apollos, but ministers by whom ye believed, even as the Lord gave to every man?
verses.web: Who then is Apollos, and who is Paul, but servants through whom you believed, and each as the Lord gave to him?
verses.ct: So who is Paul? Who is Apollos? We're just servants who helped you come to faith. Each of us did the work the Lord assigned to us.

verses.kjv: I have planted, Apollos watered; but God gave the increase.
verses.web: I planted. Apollos watered. But God gave the increase.
verses.ct: I planted the seed, Apollos watered it, but God is the one who made it grow.

verses.kjv: So then neither is he that planteth any thing, neither he that watereth; but God that giveth the increase.
verses.web: So then neither he who plants is anything, nor he who waters, but God who gives the increase.
verses.ct: The one who plants doesn't matter, and the one who waters doesn't matter. The only one who matters is God, because he's the one who makes things grow.

verses.kjv: Now he that planteth and he that watereth are one: and every man shall receive his own reward according to his own labour.
verses.web: Now he who plants and he who waters are the same, but each will receive his own reward according to his own labor.
verses.ct: The planter and the waterer are on the same team, and each one will be rewarded based on their own work.

verses.kjv: For we are labourers together with God: ye are God’s husbandry, ye are God’s building.
verses.web: For we are God’s fellow workers. You are God’s farming, God’s building.
verses.ct: We are fellow workers serving God. You are God's field, God's building.

verses.kjv: According to the grace of God which is given unto me, as a wise masterbuilder, I have laid the foundation, and another buildeth thereon. But let every man take heed how he buildeth thereupon.
verses.web: According to the grace of God which was given to me, as a wise master builder I laid a foundation, and another builds on it. But let each man be careful how he builds on it.
verses.ct: By the grace God gave me, I laid a foundation like a skilled master builder, and someone else is building on it. But everyone who builds on it should be very careful how they build.

verses.kjv: For other foundation can no man lay than that is laid, which is Jesus Christ.
verses.web: For no one can lay any other foundation than that which has been laid, which is Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: No one can lay any foundation other than the one already laid, which is Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: Now if any man build upon this foundation gold, silver, precious stones, wood, hay, stubble;
verses.web: But if anyone builds on the foundation with gold, silver, costly stones, wood, hay, or stubble,
verses.ct: Now someone might build on that foundation with gold, silver, precious stones, wood, hay, or straw.

verses.kjv: Every man’s work shall be made manifest: for the day shall declare it, because it shall be revealed by fire; and the fire shall try every man’s work of what sort it is.
verses.web: each man’s work will be revealed. For the Day will declare it, because it is revealed in fire; and the fire itself will test what sort of work each man’s work is.
verses.ct: Everyone's work will eventually be exposed. The Day of judgment will bring it to light, because it will be revealed by fire — and that fire will test the quality of each person's work.

verses.kjv: If any man’s work abide which he hath built thereupon, he shall receive a reward.
verses.web: If any man’s work remains which he built on it, he will receive a reward.
verses.ct: If what someone has built survives the fire, that person will receive a reward.

verses.kjv: If any man’s work shall be burned, he shall suffer loss: but he himself shall be saved; yet so as by fire.
verses.web: If any man’s work is burned, he will suffer loss, but he himself will be saved, but as through fire.
verses.ct: If their work burns up, they'll lose everything they built. They themselves will be saved, but only barely — like someone escaping through flames.

verses.kjv: Know ye not that ye are the temple of God, and that the Spirit of God dwelleth in you?
verses.web: Don’t you know that you are a temple of God, and that God’s Spirit lives in you?
verses.ct: Don't you realize that you are God's temple and that the Holy Spirit lives in you?

verses.kjv: If any man defile the temple of God, him shall God destroy; for the temple of God is holy, which temple ye are.
verses.web: If anyone destroys God’s temple, God will destroy him; for God’s temple is holy, which you are.
verses.ct: If anyone destroys God's temple, God will destroy them. Because God's temple is holy — and that temple is you.

verses.kjv: Let no man deceive himself. If any man among you seemeth to be wise in this world, let him become a fool, that he may be wise.
verses.web: Let no one deceive himself. If anyone thinks that he is wise among you in this world, let him become a fool, that he may become wise.
verses.ct: Don't fool yourselves. If any of you think you're wise by this world's standards, you need to become a "fool" so you can become truly wise.

verses.kjv: For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God. For it is written, He taketh the wise in their own craftiness.
verses.web: For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God. For it is written, “He has taken the wise in their craftiness.”
verses.ct: The wisdom of this world is foolishness to God. As Scripture says, "He catches the wise in their own cleverness."

verses.kjv: And again, The Lord knoweth the thoughts of the wise, that they are vain.
verses.web: And again, “The Lord knows the reasoning of the wise, that it is worthless.”
verses.ct: And again, "The Lord knows that the thoughts of the wise are worthless."

verses.kjv: Therefore let no man glory in men. For all things are yours;
verses.web: Therefore let no one boast in men. For all things are yours,
verses.ct: So stop boasting about which leader you follow. Everything already belongs to you:

verses.kjv: Whether Paul, or Apollos, or Cephas, or the world, or life, or death, or things present, or things to come; all are yours;
verses.web: whether Paul, or Apollos, or Cephas, or the world, or life, or death, or things present, or things to come. All are yours,
verses.ct: Paul, Apollos, Cephas, the world, life, death, the present, the future — it's all yours.

verses.kjv: And ye are Christ’s; and Christ is God’s.
verses.web: and you are Christ’s, and Christ is God’s.
verses.ct: And you belong to Christ, and Christ belongs to God.
